author: matkt0
content:
In the other JSON RPC methods we always use "hash" in the json when we return a block. Why in the Rayonism specification  it is "blockHash". Why not harmonize with other JSON RPC APIs ?

> blockHash: DATA, 32 Bytes - hash of this block.

Rayonism : https://notes.ethereum.org/@n0ble/rayonism-the-merge-spec#Assemble-Block
Example of GetBlockByHash method : https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/#eth_getblockbyhash

author: protolambda
content: <@!680337202521440470> good suggestion, but keep in mind the JSON-RPC is mostly reviewed for what it contains, not naming or polishing yet. There is still a good chance that we move away from JSON-RPC, to separate consensus interaction from application interaction (and security) more.

author: m.kalinin
content: This name is used by `ExecutionPayload.block_hash` field which holds a hash of corresponding `PowBlock` structure and would loose a bit of context if would be turned into just `hash`. `SetHead` and `FinaliseBlock` may indeed use `hash` without loss of generality

author: lukaszrozmej
content: is it worth it though? Json RPC allows us to use different transport layers
